main event: A witness in Xenia, Ohio reported seeing a strange, unidentified light in the sky on May 19, 1957.
interesting points: The object appeared as a steady, intense white light, about the size of a quarter moon.
The object moved slowly from left to right across the horizon, with no sound.
There were no changes in brightness or size during the sighting, which lasted around 17 minutes.
The witness described the object as something they had never seen before, and that it was not a star or helicopter.
The Air Force sent the witness a questionnaire to gather more information about the sighting.
sighted object: a bright, steady white light in the sky
